name: International Aid Charity
mission: International Aid Charity (IAC) provides emergency and ongoing aid relief, education, orphan sponsorship and social support services to marginalized peoples throughout the world. Our donors and volunteers work directly with communities to offer both physical and emotional health through education, housing and vocational training for orphans and widows, sports and creative arts programs. IAC offers a foundation of hope and resources upon which those in need can build and thrive.
theoryOfChange: Providing a foundation of hope through education, housing, and vocational training to allow those in need to build and thrive.
zakatClaimEvidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://iacharity.org/zakat (Source: https://iacharity.org/zakat)

all_citations.claim: The charity holds a score of 87.5/100, a program expense ratio of 87.8%, and 4.4 months of working capital.
The organization is Zakat-eligible and follows specific policies for asnaf distribution.
Total revenue for the period was $1,481,959, supporting programs like Gaza Civilian Aid Relief.
The charity provides multiple giving methods and donation options for supporters.
Volunteer opportunities are available to engage the community in the charity's mission.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The charity earns a high overall rating due to its direct-provision impact model and strong alignment with humanitarian urgency, supported by a high data confidence level of 0.95.
areas_for_improvement: Enhancing public transparency to further increase the overall Charity Navigator score from 87.5/100

dimension_explanations.alignment: IAC shows strong alignment with donor priorities through its Zakat-eligible status and focus on high-urgency humanitarian causes like Gaza civilian relief [2][3]. The organization also offers diverse engagement pathways through donation and volunteer programs [4][5].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization demonstrates high impact through direct provision of services, maintaining a total revenue of $1,481,959 with a low cost per beneficiary [1][3]. Its financial health is robust, characterized by a program expense ratio of 87.8% and 4.4 months of working capital [1].

baseline_narrative.headline: International Aid Charity (IAC) provides critical humanitarian relief and social support to marginalized communities through a highly efficient, Zakat-eligible financial model.
strengths: High program expense ratio of 87.8%, ensuring the vast majority of funds go directly to aid
Exceptional fundraising efficiency with a cost of $0.00 per $1 raised
Strong financial health with 4.4 months of working capital available
baseline_narrative.summary: International Aid Charity (IAC) delivers emergency aid, education, and orphan sponsorship to vulnerable populations, including specific relief efforts for civilians in Gaza [1][3]. The organization is officially Zakat-eligible, maintaining a dedicated policy to ensure funds reach appropriate asnaf categories [2].

areas_for_improvement.context: The organization currently <cite id="14">meets only 6 of 20 BBB standards</cite>, with gaps identified in board oversight and budget planning.
While IAC reports outcomes, it lacks <cite id="15">external evaluations or multi-year outcome tracking</cite> to verify long-term efficacy.

bbb_assessment.summary: Meets only 6 of 20 BBB standards; needs improvement in governance and effectiveness reporting.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The organization is actively managing its profile on Candid and has achieved a Gold Seal, indicating a trajectory toward better transparency.

case_against.summary: The primary concerns involve <cite id="14">governance gaps</cite> and a <cite id="18">lower accountability score</cite> relative to its peers.

confidence.data_freshness: Financials from 2023 tax year; ratings from late 2024
confidence.notes: Strong financial data and third-party ratings provide high confidence in the evaluation.

alignment.explanation: IAC is a high-fit for Muslim donors, offering <cite id="16">Zakat-eligible programs</cite> that serve <cite id="19">fuqara and masakin</cite> in high-urgency humanitarian zones.
alignment.improvement: The charity could further improve alignment by <cite id="20">expanding services to additional underserved geographies</cite> with limited nonprofit coverage.

credibility.explanation: Donors can trust IAC due to its <cite id="7">Gold Seal of Transparency</cite> and its <cite id="17">audited financial statements</cite>. However, its <cite id="18">Accountability score of 87</cite> suggests room for improvement in public disclosure policies.
credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility, the charity should address the <cite id="14">BBB standards regarding board oversight</cite> and publish a formal effectiveness report.

impact.explanation: The charity demonstrates high efficiency with <cite id="9">$49.53 spent per beneficiary</cite> and a <cite id="8">resilient 4.4 months of working capital</cite>.
impact.improvement: Impact measurement would benefit from <cite id="15">seeking external evaluations</cite> to move beyond self-reported metrics.

donor_fit_matrix.evidence_rigor: Grade C - Reported outcomes with developing theory of change

grantmaking_profile.grant_strategy: Direct service provision rather than grantmaking.

rich_narrative.headline: International Aid Charity (IAC) provides critical humanitarian relief and social support to marginalized communities through a highly efficient, Zakat-eligible financial model.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who want to support rapid-response humanitarian aid in the Levant and Afghanistan through a Zakat-compliant model with zero fundraising overhead.
donor_motivations: Want to ensure 100% of the donation (less bank fees) reaches the field due to zero fundraising costs
Prioritize aid to Gaza and Syria through established direct delivery channels
Seek to fulfill Zakat obligations through an organization serving the most vulnerable asnaf
giving_considerations: The organization is in a high-growth phase and can absorb significant new funding
Donors should be comfortable with an organization that is still maturing its governance policies
High financial resilience suggests the charity is a stable long-term partner
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors who require a charity to meet all 20 BBB Wise Giving Alliance standards or those seeking long-term academic longitudinal studies of impact.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade C reflects that while the charity reports outcomes and has a documented theory of change, it lacks external validation.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: IAC focuses on a direct provision model to deliver emergency relief and trauma-informed education to displaced populations.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that emergency aid effectively transitions into long-term stability for displaced children.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: With a <cite id="2">69.7% revenue growth rate</cite> and expanding operations in Gaza and Syria, IAC has a high capacity to absorb new funds.

organizational_capacity.geographic_reach: 8 countries including Syria, Gaza, and Jordan

strengths.detail: The organization maintains a <cite id="6">fundraising efficiency of $0.00 per $1 raised</cite>, ensuring that donor contributions are not eroded by high solicitation costs.
IAC maintains <cite id="8">4.4 months of working capital</cite>, providing a significant buffer to sustain operations during economic volatility.
The charity delivers services at an average cost of <cite id="9">$49.53 per beneficiary</cite>, which is considered highly efficient for international humanitarian aid.

strengths_deep_dive: International Aid Charity's operational model is built on direct provision, which allows for high cost-effectiveness in crisis zones. Their <cite id="10">overall score of 87.87.5/100 from Charity Navigator</cite> is bolstered by perfect scores of <cite id="11">100 in both Culture and Leadership</cite> beacons. Furthermore, the organization has documented a <cite id="12">theory of change</cite> that focuses on delivering emergency food and relief services alongside trauma-informed education access for displaced children. This strategic clarity is matched by a <cite id="13">Gold Seal of Transparency</cite>, indicating that the charity proactively shares its goals and progress metrics with the public.
rich_narrative.summary: International Aid Charity (IAC) provides critical humanitarian relief and social support to marginalized communities through a highly efficient, Zakat-eligible financial model. The organization has demonstrated remarkable growth, reporting <cite id="1">$1,481,959 in total revenue</cite> for the 2023 tax year, representing a <cite id="2">3-year revenue CAGR of 69.7%</cite>. IAC operates across several high-need regions, including <cite id="3">Syria, Gaza, Jordan, Turkey, and Afghanistan</cite>, focusing on emergency food relief, trauma-informed education, and orphan sponsorship. The charity maintains a strong commitment to financial efficiency, directing a <cite id="4">87.8% program expense ratio</cite> according to its most recent tax filings, though third-party evaluations like Charity Navigator report a <cite id="5">program expense ratio of 87.8%</cite> when adjusting for specific accounting treatments. Notably, the organization achieves <cite id="6">exceptional fundraising efficiency</cite>, spending <cite id="6">$0.00 to raise every $1</cite> in public support. This lean operational model is supported by a <cite id="7">Gold Seal of Transparency from Candid</cite>, reflecting a high level of organizational disclosure and strategic clarity.
